translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with the Long Parable

analyzed: pañca aṅguli yat thera a padāna

translated: the Elder of the world, the best of men;
the Sage who is skilled in dwellings.
I went into the presence of the Victor;
And I offered a five-fingered (greeting) to the Sambuddha,
I do not know of a bad destination,
the fruit of offering the five fingers.
I was a King, a Lord of the Earth;
I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the venerable Elder Pañcaṅgulin recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā pañcaṅguliyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Pañcaṅguliyattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā pañcaṅguliyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  pañcaṅguliya therassa apadānam dasama
translated: The Elder Pañcaṅgulin’s Birth Story is the tenth.
The Chapter with the Long Parable is the seventeenth.🔽The summary:
and the one with the fifty-four verses.
